result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marvette L McDowell in court with attorney Daniel P Murray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CM676, Court grants the State's motion. Apply bail to 14CM676.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvette L McDowell in court with attorney Daniel P Murray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a new date to allow time to incorporate the new misdemeanor charges in case 2014CM676 with regards to the State's offer.  Court grants request.  Court will give a Jury Status/Jury Trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Marvette L McDowell in court with attorney Daniel P Murray.  Brian J Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marvette L McDowell in court with attorney Daniel Patrick Murray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
ALONG WITH A SIGNATURE BOND OF $1000.00  Defendant to have no contact with Latoya G, Diamond A or any Walmart Store.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
ALONG WITH POSTING OF $250.00 CASH BAIL.  Defendant to have no contact with Latoya G, Diamond A or any Walmart Store.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Marvette L McDowell in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B. Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
